metadata.title: CVE-2024-40725 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A partial fix forÂ  CVE-2024-39884 in the core of Apache HTTP Server 2.4.61ignores some use of the legacy content-type based configuration ofhandlers. "AddType" and similar configuration, under some circumstanceswhere files are requested indirectly, result in source code disclosure oflocal content. For example, PHP scripts may be served instead ofinterpreted.Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.62, which fixes this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-40725` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
apache2-bin - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
apache2-data - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
apache2-utils - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.52-1ubuntu4.12').
